definition: James Bruce, 8th Earl of Elgin (1811-1863), British High Commissioner to China who ordered the looting and destruction of the Old Winter Palace Yuanmingyuan 圓明園|圆明园 in 1860/Thomas Bruce, 7th Earl of Elgin (1766-1841), who stole the Parthenon Marbles in 1801-1810
abbr. for Egypt 埃及[Ai1 ji2]
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
the Elgin Marbles, the Parthenon marbles stolen in 1801-1810 by Thomas Bruce, 7th Earl of Elgin
pinyin: Ai1 er3 jin1 da4 li3 shi2

sentences.english: Clippers Vice President of Basketball Operations Elgin Baylor said.
sentences.chinese: 快船隊籃球業務副總裁埃爾金貝勒說。

sentences.english: "It's about avoiding the expensive mistakes, " Elgin says.
sentences.chinese: “這是關於避免昂貴的錯誤，”埃爾金說。
